title: How bitcoin price drops affect corporate buyers
description: The sharp year-end drop in cryptocurrency prices has shaken companies that made large investments in bitcoin, causing their stock prices to fall and raising renewed concerns about a market bubble.

title: Nvidia licenses tech from AI startup Groq
description: Nvidia has entered a non-exclusive agreement to license technology from AI startup Groq. As part of the deal, Groq's founder, president, and several engineers will join Nvidia.

title: China proposes rules for human-like AI service
description: China's internet watchdog released draft regulations on Saturday proposing stricter oversight of AI services that mimic human personalities and form emotional connections with users.

title: Bangladesh wins 11 awards at International Robot Olympiad 2025
description: Bangladesh won a total of 11 awards at the 27th International Robot Olympiad (IRO) 2025. Nine students from the country received medals and technical awards in different categories at the international competition.

title: Japan plans $19 billion domestic AI project
description: Japan is preparing to launch a public-private artificial intelligence project worth an estimated 3 trillion yen (approximately $19 billion) to develop the country's largest AI foundation model.

title: You can now use WhatsApp to report social media posts inciting violence
description: The National Cyber Security Agency (NCSA) has urged the public to directly report social media content that incites terrorism or violence through WhatsApp and email, according to a press release issued on December 20, 2025.

title: Government introduces Bangla-based AI platform and new font for official use
description: The government has introduced the country’s first artificial intelligence (AI) platform named “kagoj.ai” developed specifically for the Bangla language, alongside the launch of a new Bangla font called “July” intended for official and institutional use.

title: Human typing speed is slowing AI progress: OpenAI executive
description: Alexander Embiricos, Product Manager of OpenAI's Codex coding agent, has recently stated that a key bottleneck in developing advanced artificial intelligence is the speed at which humans can type.

title: AI agent performance: more isn't always better, study finds
description: It’s long been assumed that if one AI agent is good, more must be better. But new research from Google, DeepMind, and MIT reveals that’s not true. In fact, the study has found that adding AI agents can sometimes slash performance by up to 70%.

title: Bangladeshi team wins silver at Seoul International Invention Fair 2025
description: A team from Bangladesh named Calibrator-Z has won a silver medal at the Seoul International Invention Fair (SIIF) 2025, an annually held global tech innovation competition.
